verses.text: 脫離律法的約束歸屬基督弟兄們，我對懂得律法的人說，你們不曉得律法管轄人，是在他活著的期間嗎？

words.definition: to belong to, to be subject to

words.note: Used as a collective term for male believers in the Bible.
More formal/literary than 知道 (zhīdào).
Often used in administrative or formal contexts.

verses.text: 一個已婚的婦人，在丈夫活著的時候，她是受律法約束歸屬丈夫；丈夫若死了，她就脫離丈夫在律法上的約束。

words.note: A more classical/formal equivalent of 如果 (rúguǒ).
Indicates scope or aspect, e.g., 'in terms of the law'.

verses.text: 所以，當丈夫還活著的時候，如果她歸屬別的男人，就稱為淫婦；丈夫若死了，她就脫離了律法的約束，如果她歸屬別的男人，也不是淫婦。

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: 稱為 (chēngwéi) means 'to be called as/a'.
A strong term for a sexually immoral woman, often used in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 這樣，我的弟兄們，你們藉著基督的身體，對律法來說也已經死了，使你們歸屬另一位，就是那從死人中復活的，為的是要我們結果子給　神。

words.note: A common phrase: '對...來說' (duì...láishuō) means 'as far as...is concerned'.
Used as a postposition, e.g., '從死人中' means 'from among the dead'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., '那...復活的' means 'the one who resurrected'.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of
words.note: Fixed phrase '為的是要...' means 'the purpose is to...'

words.definition: to want, to need, so that

words.note: Verb-object compound. Often used metaphorically in the Bible.

verses.text: 我們從前屬肉體的時候，罪惡的情慾藉著律法在我們的肢體裡發動，就結出死亡的果子。

words.definition: to belong to, to be part of

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to human sinful nature.
Often refers to body parts, but can metaphorically mean members of a group.
Used as a postposition, e.g., '在...裡' means 'in the...'

words.definition: to stir up, to be aroused
words.note: Can mean 'to start' (a machine), but here contextually 'to be activated/stirred up'.

breakdown.m: to go out, to come out

words.note: Often used with '果子' (guǒzi) to mean 'to bear fruit'.
Often used metaphorically in the Bible for results or outcomes.

verses.text: 但現在，我們既然向那捆綁我們的律法死了，就脫離了律法的約束，好讓我們用心靈的新樣子，而不用儀文的舊方式來服事主。

words.note: Often refers to physical restraint, but here used metaphorically.
Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
Often used in religious contexts for the inner spiritual being.
Refers to the literal, written commandments or rituals.
Commonly used in religious contexts for serving God.
Capitalized as it refers to God/Jesus.

verses.text: 善惡兩律在心中交戰這樣，我們可以說甚麼呢？難道律法是罪嗎？絕對不是。不過，如果不是藉著律法，我就不知道甚麼是罪；如果不是律法說「不可貪心」，我就不知道甚麼是貪心。

words.note: Short for 律法 (lǜfǎ).
Used to pose rhetorical questions, often implying doubt or challenge.
Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
In a biblical context, usually refers to sin against God.
Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
In a biblical context, usually refers to sin against God.
Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
In biblical context, often refers to covetousness.
In biblical context, often refers to covetousness.

verses.text: 但罪趁著機會，藉著誡命在我裡面發動各樣的貪心，因為沒有律法，罪是死的。

words.note: In a biblical context, usually refers to sin against God.
Refers to divine commandments.
Can also mean 'to start' (an engine).
In biblical context, often refers to covetousness.
Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
In a biblical context, usually refers to sin against God.

verses.text: 在沒有律法的時候，我是活的；但誡命一來，罪就活了，

words.note: Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
Refers to divine commandments.
In a biblical context, usually refers to sin against God.

verses.text: 我就死了，那本來使人活的誡命，反而使我死了；

words.note: Refers to divine commandments.

verses.text: 因為罪藉著誡命把握著機會來欺騙我，並且殺了我。

words.note: Refers to theological concept of sin.

verses.text: 這樣，律法是聖潔的，誡命也是聖潔、公義和良善的。

words.note: Refers to the Mosaic Law or God's law.
Often used in a moral/ethical sense in biblical context.

verses.text: 既是這樣，那良善的反而使我死嗎？絕對不是！但罪藉著那良善的使我死，就顯出真是罪，為了要使罪藉著誡命變成更加邪惡。

words.definition: since this is so, if this is the case

verses.text: 我們知道律法是屬靈的，我卻是屬肉體的，已經賣給罪了。

words.note: Lit. 'belonging to the spirit'.
Lit. 'belonging to the flesh/body'.

verses.text: 因為我所作的，我不明白；我所願意的，我沒有去作，我所恨惡的，我倒去作。

words.definition: what is done, that which I do
words.note: 所 (suǒ) forms a nominalizer for the following verb.

verses.text: 如果我所不願意的，我倒去作，我就不得不承認律法是好的。

words.note: Used to nominalize a following verb phrase.

words.definition: to be willing to, to want

words.note: Indicates engagement in the following action.
A double negative expressing obligation.
Refers specifically to God's law or the Mosaic Law.

verses.text: 既是這樣，那就不是我作的，而是住在我裡面的罪作的。

words.definition: since it is, as it is

verses.text: 我知道在我裡面，就是在我肉體之中，沒有良善，因為立志行善由得我，行出來卻由不得我。

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to human nature apart from divine influence.
Refers to inherent moral goodness.

words.definition: to resolve, to set one's will
to be up to, to be allowed
words.note: Indicates ability or being within one's power.
'出來' is a directional complement indicating completion or outward manifestation.

words.definition: not be up to, not allowed
words.note: Indicates inability or being beyond one's power.

verses.text: 所以我願意行的善，我沒有去行；我不願意作的惡，我倒去作了。

words.definition: to be willing to, to want

words.note: Used to negate past actions.
Indicates engagement in the following action.

words.definition: to be willing to, to want

words.note: Indicates engagement in the following action.

verses.text: 我若作自己不願意作的事，那就不是我作的，而是住在我裡面的罪作的。

words.definition: to be willing to, to want

verses.text: 因此，我發現了一個律，就是我想向善的時候，惡就在我裡面出現。

words.note: Often refers to divine or moral law in biblical context.

verses.text: 按著我裡面的人來說，我是喜歡　神的律，

words.note: Often refers to divine or moral law in biblical context.

verses.text: 但我發覺肢體中另有一個律，和我心中的律爭戰，把我擄去附從肢體中的罪律。

words.note: Often refers to divine or moral law in biblical context.
Often refers to divine or moral law in biblical context.

verses.text: 我這個人真是苦啊！誰能救我脫離這使我死亡的身體呢？
感謝　神，藉著我們的主耶穌基督就能脫離了。可見，一方面我自己心裡服事　神的律，另一方面我的肉體卻服事罪的律。

words.note: Often refers to divine or moral law in biblical context.
Often refers to divine or moral law in biblical context.
